title: UCSB Smithsonian Scholars Program
text:
The  UCSB Smithsonian Scholars Program  is an initiatiative between the UCSB Office of Education and Partnerships and the Smithsonian to engage first-generation, minority students with opportunities and mentoriship to enter the field of envrionmental science.
Program Assistant (September 2022 - Present) 

  ðŸš§ Under Construction ðŸš§
  


Field Crew Member (January 2019 - January 2021)
 
  Monitored camera traps used to track the endemic Channel Island Spotted Skunk
  Led field crew in camera trap deployment and data collection protocol
  Conducted field work with diverse team in a remote setting and
recorded data in data base and analyzed using R-Code


 Participant Early Research Experience Smithsonian Summer Program (August 2019)

 Participated in intensive two-week  summer program that introduced R-Coding program, and conservation research
  Learned about field research methods, camera traps, audio moth, and bioacoustics
  Studied diverse fauna and flora
  Conducted short-term field research project with a team of 4

title: UCSB Promise Scholars Program
text:
The  UCSB Promise Scholars Program  is a program that empowers first generation students to achieve higher education and provides a 120,000 financial aid award for students throughout their four years.


Promise Scholar 2018 - 2022


Promise Scholar Advisory Board


Executive Co-Chair & Co-Founder (September 2020 - June 2022)



Organized spaces for low income and underrepresented studentsâ€™ educational growth


Collaborated with board to plan, coordinate events and create opportunities for scholars to network within community


Created a professional board with long lasting procedures to ensure continuation of board



Social Chair (October 2018 - September 2020)



Organized Promise Scholar branding and outreach to community


Developed and led marketing strategy for events and advertisements


Launched social media platforms and gained following of 350 followers on Instagram reaching 70% of Promise Scholars

title: National Park Services SCRLC
text:
Data Science Intern (March 2021 - June 2021)



Analyzed data sets and visualized findings using R-Code language


Collaborated with team to study NPS data and systematize findings

title: Medici Archive Project
text:
Conducted digitization of letters and documents of the Italian Medici family dating from 1537-1743 
Presented my background and research purposes in Italian to access the files in the Italian National Archive<.li>
Transitioned physical files to  platform  that contains 26,000 transcribed documents available to scholars around the globe

title: Smithsonian Office of Chief Information Officer (OCIO) Data Science Lab
text: As a summer 2021 undergraduate intern I worked on studying the genomics and evolution of the genus Syntrichia. Programmed Unix Shells to align, sort, and organize genetic DNA sequence and build gene trees of the genus Syntrichia. Applied R-Code, and learned Python to explore large data sets for each samples. Used R & Python to manipulate and analyze 600+ data sets with large data samples.
